subject: fast holes =tesla/bedini/bearden "radiant energy"--shown by absence/presence of "miller effect"
author: Ken Thomas

  &&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&
   
   
  http://www.williamson-labs.com/480_xtor.htm#emitter-follower
   
   
   
   
  in the spook radio, the is only current gain, that makes the ampllification the highest frequency and lowest noise possible.  the output is taken from emitter 
   
  feedback is taken off before signal reaches out put.  result is : only fast holes are fed to input so NOISELESS  voltage gain results from transformer action and also from the inherent high voltage of radiant energy which is about the same as holes that are so fast that there is no lag in the phase and they can build up voltage by repeated laps around the regenerative section.
   
   
             
   
   
   
   
   
  Another attribute is its excellent high frequency response. Because there is no voltage gain, or because it has a gain of ~ 1, the bandwidth is equal to the cutoff frequency of the transistor,  Ft(where Ft = [Hfe = 1]: BW = Ft).
      .    Note: because there is no voltage gain, there is no multiplication of the base/collector capacitance (Co) which reduces the high frequency response of common emitter amplifiers; see, also: Miller effect.
